UndoManager.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Audacity: A Digital Audio Editor
00004 
00005   UndoManager.h
00006 
00007   Dominic Mazzoni
00008   
00009   After each operation, call UndoManager's PushState, pass it
00010   the entire track hierarchy.  The UndoManager makes a duplicate
00011   of every single track using its Duplicate method, which should
00012   increment reference counts.  If we were not at the top of
00013   the stack when this is called, delete above first.
00014 
00015   If a minor change is made, for example changing the visual
00016   display of a track or changing the selection, you can call
00017   ModifyState, which replaces the current state with the 
00018   one you give it, without deleting everything above it.
00019 
00020   Each action has a long description and a short description
00021   associated with it.  The long description appears in the
00022   History window and should be a complete sentence in the
00023   past tense, for example, "Deleted 2 seconds.".  The short
00024   description should be one or two words at most, all
00025   capitalized, and should represent the name of the command.
00026   It will be appended on the end of the word "Undo" or "Redo",
00027   for example the short description of "Deleted 2 seconds."
00028   would just be "Delete", resulting in menu titles
00029   "Undo Delete" and "Redo Delete".
00030 
00031   UndoManager can also automatically consolidate actions into
00032   a single state change.  If the "consolidate" argument to
00033   PushState is true, then up to 3 identical events in a row
00034   will result in one PushState and 2 ModifyStates.
00035 
00036   Undo() temporarily moves down one state and returns the track
00037   hierarchy.  If another PushState is called, the redo information
00038   is lost.
00039 
00040   Redo() 
00041 
00042   UndoAvailable()
00043   
00044   RedoAvailable()
00045 
00046 **********************************************************************/
00047 
00048 #ifndef __AUDACITY_UNDOMANAGER__
00049 #define __AUDACITY_UNDOMANAGER__

00051 #include <wx/dynarray.h>
00052 #include <wx/string.h>
00053 #include "ondemand/ODTaskThread.h"
00054 
00055 class Track;
00056 class TrackList;
00057 
00058 struct UndoStackElem {
00059    TrackList *tracks;
00060    wxString description;
00061    wxString shortDescription;
00062    double sel0;
00063    double sel1;
00064 };
00065 
00066 WX_DEFINE_USER_EXPORTED_ARRAY(UndoStackElem *, UndoStack, class AUDACITY_DLL_API);
00067 
00068 class AUDACITY_DLL_API UndoManager {
00069  public:
00070    UndoManager();
00071    ~UndoManager();
00072 
00073    void PushState(TrackList * l, double sel0, double sel1,
00074                   wxString longDescription, wxString shortDescription,
00075                   bool consolidate = false);
00076    void ModifyState(TrackList * l, double sel0, double sel1);
00077    void ClearStates();
00078    void RemoveStates(int num);  // removes the 'num' oldest states
00079    void RemoveStateAt(int n);   // removes the n'th state (1 is oldest) 
00080    unsigned int GetNumStates();
00081    unsigned int GetCurrentState();
00082 
00083    void GetShortDescription(unsigned int n, wxString *desc);
00084    void GetLongDescription(unsigned int n, wxString *desc, wxString *size);
00085    void SetLongDescription(unsigned int n, wxString desc);
00086 
00087    TrackList *SetStateTo(unsigned int n, double *sel0, double *sel1);
00088    TrackList *Undo(double *sel0, double *sel1);
00089    TrackList *Redo(double *sel0, double *sel1);
00090 
00091    bool UndoAvailable();
00092    bool RedoAvailable();
00093 
00094    bool UnsavedChanges();
00095    void StateSaved();
00096 
00097    void Debug();
00098 
00100    void SetODChangesFlag();
00101    bool HasODChangesFlag();
00102    void ResetODChangesFlag();
00103 
00104  private:
00105    int current;
00106    int saved;
00107    UndoStack stack;
00108 
00109    wxString lastAction;
00110    int consolidationCount;
00111    
00112    bool mODChanges;
00113    ODLock mODChangesMutex;//mODChanges is accessed from many threads.
00114    
00115 };
